Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition: Chatty \Chat"ty\, n. [Tamil sh[=a]ti.] A porous earthen pot used in India for cooling water, etc. [1913 Webster]

Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition: Chatty \Chat"ty\, a. Given to light, familiar talk; talkative. --Lady M. W. Montagu. [1913 Webster] ||

chatty adj 1: full of trivial conversation; "kept from her housework by gabby neighbors" [syn: {gabby}, {garrulous}, {loquacious}, {talkative}, {talky}] 2: prone to friendly informal communication [syn: {gossipy}, {newsy}] [also: {chattiest}, {chattier}]
